studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: ALXN1840 Treatment
arms.description: All participants receive ALXN1840 with dose titration from 15 mg/day for approximately 28 days followed by titration up to 30 mg/day on Day 29

studyCohorts.name: Cohort 1 (Treatment Experienced)
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients who have received WD therapy for > 28 days

studyCohorts.name: Cohort 2 (Treatment Naïve)
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients who have received WD therapy for ≤ 28 days

eligibilityCriteria.name: Decompensated cirrhosis or MELD score exclusion

population.name: Study Population
population.description: Target population defined by eligibility criteria

objectives.name: Primary Objective - Copper Balance Assessment
objectives.text: Assess net copper balance with daily repeat-dose ALXN1840 treatment (15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with Wilson disease (WD)

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Change in Copper Balance
objectives.text: Assess change in copper balance in response to ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day during ALXN1840 accumulation and at steady state periods versus the pretreatment baseline in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Copper Disposition
objectives.text: Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 (15 mg/day and 30 mg/day) on the disposition of copper in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Molybdenum Disposition
objectives.text: Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 on the disposition of molybdenum at steady state at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Molybdenum Balance
objectives.text: Assess steady-state total molybdenum balance as a measure of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Molybdenum Accumulation
objectives.text: Assess accumulation of molybdenum with ALXN1840 treatment at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective - Pharmacokinetics
objectives.text: Determine the steady-state plasma pharmacokinetic (PK) of total molybdenum and plasma ultrafiltrate (PUF) molybdenum (as surrogate measures of ALXN1840, 15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with WD

objectives.name: Safety Objective
objectives.text: Evaluate the safety and tolerability of repeated-dose administration of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective - Dose Response
objectives.text: Determine dose response of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day for copper balance in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective - Treatment Duration Effect
objectives.text: Determine the effect of treatment duration on copper balance in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective - Ceruloplasmin and Copper Profiles
objectives.text: Assess the effects of ALXN1840 on ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper LBC profiles in plasma in participants with WD

endpoints.name: Primary Endpoint - Mean Daily Copper Balance
endpoints.text: Mean daily copper balance where copper balance is measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint - Change in Mean Daily Copper Balance
endpoints.text: Change in mean daily copper balance as measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) from pretreatment baseline (Days -4 through -1) and ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint - Copper Quantification
endpoints.text: Copper quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, including plasma total and labile bound copper (LBC) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint - Molybdenum Quantification
endpoints.text: Molybdenum quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, plasma total molybdenum at ALXN1840 steady state

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint - Mean Daily Molybdenum Balance
endpoints.text: Mean daily molybdenum balance as demonstrated through measurement of molybdenum intake (in food, drink and ALXN1840), and molybdenum output (feces and urine) representing ALXN1840 steady state

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint - Molybdenum Accumulation
endpoints.text: Accumulation of molybdenum as determined by molybdenum balance

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint - PK Parameters
endpoints.text: PK parameters for plasma total and PUF-molybdenum

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint - Safety Parameters
endpoints.text: Safety parameters: Treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs)/serious adverse events (SAEs); Clinical laboratory assessments (serum chemistry, hematology, coagulation, and urinalysis); Physical examinations; Heart rate, intervals (PR, QRS, QT and QTc), and clinically significant electrocardiogram (ECG) findings as determined by triplicate 12-lead ECG; Vital sign assessments (blood pressure and heart rate)

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint - Dose Response on Copper Balance
endpoints.text: Assess dose response of ALXN1840 on copper balance focusing on copper balance

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint - Treatment Duration Effect
endpoints.text: Determine the effect of time following initiation of ALXN1840 treatment on copper balance

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint - Ceruloplasmin and Copper Changes
endpoints.text: Ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper, and LBC: Change in ceruloplasmin at Days 1, 8, 25, 29, 36, and Day 39 compared with predose

exits.name: Study Completion
exits.description: Participant completes all phases including last scheduled procedure; EOS Visit on Day 54 (+/- 2 days)

exits.name: Participant Withdrawal
exits.description: Participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request

exits.name: Investigator Withdrawal
exits.description: Participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons

exits.name: Lost to Follow-up
exits.description: Participant repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted; requires 3 telephone calls and certified letter attempts

exits.name: Study Intervention Discontinuation
exits.description: Permanent discontinuation of study intervention; participant should remain in study for safety follow-up

exits.name: Study Termination by Sponsor
exits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time

notes.text: a Within 42 days of ALXN1840 administration. Details of procedures that may be performed by sites designated as "screening sites" (only in the US) are detailed in Section 8.
b Participants will be admitted to the clinical research unit (CRU) at least 10 hours prior to enrollment and initiation of copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet.
c At the CRU's discretion, participants may remain in the CRU or be readmitted on Day 22 with all procedures starting on Day 23.
d Unscheduled study visits may occur at any time during the study and may include any study procedure as deemed necessary by the Investigator.
e Participants are required to return to the CRU Day 54+/-2; participants will be discontinued from ALXN1840 medication by their physician at the latest by the Day 54 follow-up.

f Discharge from the unit may occur after completion of all procedures on Day 9 and on Day 40 and after the Investigator has reviewed all safety assessment (including safety laboratory tests) and confirmed that the participant is appropriate for discharge.

g A single outpatient visit or phone call and safety laboratory assessment should occur between Day 14 and Day 18. A phone call may take place on a different day than the blood draw within the Day 14 through Day 18 period.
h If needed to confirm menopause.
i Parameters include age and sex. Race and ethnicity will be collected where permitted by local regulations.
j Wilson disease history will include diagnosis date, method of diagnosis, history of cirrhosis, details of any previous liver biopsies performed, and treatment received.
k A full physical examination will be performed at Screening, at check-in for the study, and at the End of the study/Early Termination Visit.
l Height at screening only.

m While in the CRU, study intervention will be administered after an overnight fast (ie, at least 10 hours) at the same time every morning; drug is to be administered with 240 mL of water and meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing.
n During the outpatient period, participants will use SMS text messaging to confirm study intervention administration.
o Blood sampling for PK/PD will occur before ALXN1840 administration and represents a predose trough.
p PK/PD collection will include timepoints described in the schedule of PK/PD assessment for Days 1, 25, 29, and 39.
q Samples for serum chemistry will be obtained following a fast of at least 8 hours at the Screening Visit and at check-in.
r Laboratory assessment including chemistry, hematology, and coagulation parameters should be performed on Days -8, -1, 8, 23, and 28 only.
s Menstruation check is for women only; women of childbearing potential should only be enrolled after a negative serum pregnancy test result at Screening.
t A single 15 mL serum sample will be retained for evaluation in the event of an unexpected safety finding.
u Vital signs measurements and ECGs should be performed predose, unless otherwise specified.
v Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet will be initiated after registration/inclusion.
w For each input/output balance period, 24-hour urine samples are to be collected for measurement of copper and molybdenum.
x For fecal samples, each individual sample will be independently collected with record of date, time, and weight of the sample.

titles.text: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840
Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Age requirement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants aged ≥18 at the time of signing the ICF.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Wilson Disease diagnosis
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Diagnosis of WD by Leipzig Criteria ≥ 4 documented by testing as outlined in the 2012 European Association for the Study of Liver WD Clinical Practice Guidelines (Ferenci, 2003; EASL, 2012) or by historical test results for WD including some or all of the following: Presence of Kayser Fleischer rings, Neurological symptoms, Serum ceruloplasmin below reference range, Coombs-negative hemolytic anemia, Elevated liver or urinary copper, Presence of mutations in the ATP7B gene, or Other, as considered appropriate, may be used instead to confirm the diagnosis of WD.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Benefit from decoppering therapy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants who in the opinion of the referring Investigator may benefit from decoppering therapy.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Study procedure compliance
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants must be able to comply with all study-related procedures.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: CRU residence capability
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants must be able to reside in the CRU for intensive metabolic monitoring of copper and molybdenum.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Chelator therapy discontinuation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants willing to discontinue chelator therapy for approximately 4 days prior to initiation of ALXN1840 to allow a baseline assessment of copper balance.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Adequate venous access
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants with adequate venous access to allow collection of required blood samples.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Ability to swallow tablets
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants must be able to swallow intact ALXN1840 tablets.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Mineral supplement avoidance
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants willing to avoid use of minerals containing copper, zinc, or molybdenum throughout the study duration.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Dietary compliance
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants willing to adhere to copper/molybdenum-controlled diet during inpatient periods and willing to comply with a low copper dietary requirement during the Outpatient Period.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Contraceptive requirements
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Contraceptive use by men or women should be consistent with local regulations regarding the methods of contraception for those participating in clinical studies. Male participants: Male participants, if heterosexually active and with a female spouse or partner of childbearing potential or a pregnant or breastfeeding spouse or partner, must agree to use barrier contraception (male condom) for the duration of the study and for at least 3 months after the end of systemic exposure of the study intervention. Male participants must not donate sperm for at least 3 months after the end of systemic exposure of the study intervention. Female spouses or partners of male participants who are of childbearing potential must use highly effective contraception, starting at least 1 menstrual cycle before (the male participant's) first study intervention administration and continuing until at least 3 months after the end of their male partner's systemic exposure to the study intervention. Barrier contraception (male condom) is required even with documented medical assessment of surgical success of a vasectomy. For male participants who have had a vasectomy (with documented evidence of azoospermia if possible) and agree to use a male condom for the stated time period, no additional contraceptive method is required by their female partner. Female participants: Female participants or female partners of male participants of childbearing potential (including breastfeeding females), if heterosexually active, must be willing to follow protocol-specified contraception guidance starting at least 1 menstrual cycle before first study intervention administration and continuing for at least 3 months after the end of systemic exposure of the study intervention. Female participants must not donate ova for at least 3 months after the end of systemic exposure of the study intervention. Female participants who are documented as being of non-childbearing potential are exempt from contraception requirements.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Informed consent capability
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants capable of giving signed informed consent, which includes compliance with the requirements and restrictions listed in the ICF and in this protocol.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Decompensated cirrhosis or MELD score exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Decompensated cirrhosis or model for end-stage liver disease (MELD) score > 13.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Modified Nazer score exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Modified Nazer score > 7 (Dhawan, 2005).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Gastrointestinal bleed exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Clinically significant gastrointestinal bleed within past 3 months.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Elevated ALT exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) > 2 × upper limit of normal (ULN).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Marked neurological disease exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Marked neurological disease requiring assistance with self-care or activities of daily life.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Low hemoglobin exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Hemoglobin less than lower limit of the reference range for age and sex.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Viral infection exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Active infection with hepatitis B virus (positive hepatitis B surface antigen) or C virus (participants with positive hepatitis C antibody result would require confirmation of active disease with a positive hepatitis C polymerase chain reaction test), or seropositivity for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Significant medical history exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History or presence of/significant history of or current cardiovascular, respiratory, hepatic, renal, gastrointestinal, endocrinological, hematological, or neurological disorders, or psychiatric disorder that in the opinion of the Investigator may constitute a risk when taking the study intervention; or may interfere with the interpretation of data.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Previous tetrathiomolybdate treatment exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Previous treatment with ALXN1840 or other form of tetrathiomolybdate within 1 year prior to dosing.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Previous zinc treatment exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Previous treatment with zinc within 21 days prior to Day 1.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Experimental therapy exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: The use of an experimental or unapproved/unlicensed therapy at the same time or within 90 days or 5 half-lives, whichever is longer, prior to the Screening Visit.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Renal failure exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants in renal failure, defined as in end-stage renal disease on dialysis (chronic kidney disease [CKD] stage 5) or creatinine clearance < 30 mL/min (Levey, 2006).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Pregnancy or breastfeeding exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Pregnant (or females who are planning to become pregnant) or breastfeeding females (women of childbearing potential must have a negative serum pregnancy test result at screening).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Known sensitivity exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Known sensitivity to ALXN1840, ALXN1840 excipients (anhydrous dicalcium phosphate, anhydrous sodium carbonate), or any of the ingredients contained in ALXN1840 or related compounds.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Non-compliance likelihood exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: In the opinion of the Investigator, the participant and/or their legal guardian is likely to be non-compliant or uncooperative during the study.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Drug or alcohol abuse exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of illicit drug abuse, history of significant alcohol abuse within 1 year prior to the Screening Visit, or clinical evidence of substance and/or alcohol abuse within the 2 years before screening. Alcohol abuse is defined as regular weekly intake of more than 14 units (for both males and females), using the following National Health Service (NHS) alcohol tracker http://www.nhs.uk/Tools/Pages/drinks-tracker.aspx.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Positive urine drug screen exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Positive urine drug toxicology screen at Screening or on Day -8 (cannabinoids will not be tested).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Recent alcohol consumption exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Alcohol consumption within 48 hours prior to study intervention administration or positive alcohol breath test at screening or on Day -8.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Dietary non-compliance exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants unwilling to consistently complete every meal and tolerate a controlled, limited menu for the duration of the study.

studyInterventions.name: ALXN1840
studyInterventions.description: Novel copper binding agent (bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate) for treatment of Wilson disease

amendments.name: Amendment 1
amendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update procedures outlined in the Schedule of Activities, remove contradictory text on the reporting of serious adverse events, and add details of an interim analysis.

amendments.name: Amendment 2
amendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to revise the exclusion criterion for a urine drug screen. Changes implemented via Administrative Letter 1 and Administrative Letter 2, as well as COVID vaccination guidance, have also been incorporated.

amendments.name: Amendment 3
amendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update the washout period for zinc.

amendments.name: Amendment 3.1 (US)
amendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.

medicalDevices.name: Automated Blood Pressure Device
medicalDevices.label: Automated BP Monitor
medicalDevices.description: Completely automated device for blood pressure and heart rate measurements; manual techniques used only if automated device not available

medicalDevices.name: 12-Lead ECG Device
medicalDevices.label: ECG Machine
medicalDevices.description: Device for performing triplicate 12-lead electrocardiograms to assess heart rate, intervals, and cardiac findings

medicalDevices.name: Inductively Coupled Plasma Mass Spectrometer
medicalDevices.label: ICP-MS
medicalDevices.description: Analytical device for determining copper and molybdenum concentrations in biological and food samples

medicalDevices.name: Intravenous Cannula
medicalDevices.label: IV Catheter
medicalDevices.description: Cannula for venous access to minimize needle sticks during repeated blood sampling

medicalDevices.name: Water Bottle Dispenser
medicalDevices.label: Large Water Dispenser
medicalDevices.description: Large water bottle dispenser from which all participants drink; samples collected for copper and molybdenum analysis

conditions.name: ALT Elevation Criteria
conditions.text: ALT > 3 × ULN requires dose reduction; ALT > 5 × ULN requires temporary interruption

conditions.name: Hemoglobin Decrease Criteria
conditions.text: > 20% decrease from baseline requires dose reduction; > 30% decrease requires temporary interruption

conditions.name: Platelet Decrease Criteria
conditions.text: > 20% decrease from baseline requires dose reduction; > 30% decrease requires temporary interruption

conditions.name: Neutrophil Decrease Criteria
conditions.text: > 20% decrease from baseline requires dose reduction; > 30% decrease requires dose reduction with no further increase

conditions.name: Bilirubin Elevation with ALT
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN indicative of liver injury requires temporary interruption

conditions.name: Neurological Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of neurologic worsening requiring evaluation
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.text: Clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening including suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis

conditions.name: Renal Function Exclusion
conditions.text: End-stage renal disease on dialysis (CKD stage 5) or creatinine clearance < 30 mL/min

conditions.name: Safety Review Committee Approval
conditions.description: SRC review required before dose titration
conditions.text: SRC will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant before titration to 30 mg/day

study.name: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

administrations.name: ALXN1840 15 mg every other day (dose reduction)
administrations.duration: As needed per dose modification criteria

substances.name: bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate
substances.description: Active pharmaceutical ingredient containing tetrathiomolybdic acid (7.8 mg per 15 mg tablet)

studyDefinitionDocument.name: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

transitionRules.name: Run-in to Treatment Period 1
transitionRules.text: Following Run-in Period, participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day on Day 1

transitionRules.name: Treatment Period 1 to Outpatient
transitionRules.text: Participants may be discharged from the CRU on Day 9 to return on Day 22 or Day 23

transitionRules.name: Outpatient to Treatment Period 2
transitionRules.text: Participants return on Day 22 or Day 23 (predose); all procedures will start on Day 23

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration 15mg to 30mg
transitionRules.text: Increase to 30 mg/day on Day 29 after SRC review of safety data through Day 23

transitionRules.name: ALT Elevation Dose Reduction
transitionRules.text: ALT > 3 × ULN: Reduce dose to previous dose level or reduce to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD

transitionRules.name: ALT Elevation Dose Interruption
transitionRules.text: ALT > 5 × ULN: Temporary interruption with weekly repeat testing

transitionRules.name: Hemoglobin Decrease Dose Reduction
transitionRules.text: > 20% decrease from baseline: Reduce dose to previous level or 15 mg QOD

transitionRules.name: Hemoglobin Decrease Dose Interruption
transitionRules.text: > 30% decrease from baseline: Temporary interruption

transitionRules.name: Platelet Decrease Dose Reduction
transitionRules.text: > 20% decrease from baseline: Reduce dose to previous level or 15 mg QOD

transitionRules.name: Platelet Decrease Dose Interruption
transitionRules.text: > 30% decrease from baseline: Temporary interruption

transitionRules.name: Neutrophil Decrease Dose Reduction
transitionRules.text: > 20% decrease from baseline: Reduce dose to previous level or 15 mg QOD

transitionRules.name: Neutrophil Decrease No Titration
transitionRules.text: > 30% decrease from baseline with neutrophils below reference range: No further dose increase until resolution

transitionRules.name: Liver Injury Dose Interruption
transitionRules.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN with ALT > 3 × ULN: Temporary interruption with weekly repeat testing

transitionRules.name: Serious Hypersensitivity Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: Serious hypersensitivity reaction requires discontinuation from study intervention

transitionRules.name: Severe Infection Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: Severe uncontrolled infection requires discontinuation from study intervention

transitionRules.name: Disallowed Medication Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: Use of disallowed medication requires discontinuation from study intervention

transitionRules.name: Pregnancy Discontinuation
transitionRules.text: Pregnancy or planned pregnancy requires discontinuation from study intervention

transitionRules.name: Rechallenge After ALT Interruption
transitionRules.text: Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD or less frequent when ALT is below 3 × ULN; maximum 3 rechallenges allowed

transitionRules.name: Rechallenge After Hematologic Interruption
transitionRules.text: Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD or less frequent when hemoglobin and platelets are at baseline concentration

transitionRules.name: Rechallenge After Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD or less frequent when bilirubin is below ULN; requires Medical Monitor approval

studyChanges.beforeText: However, the physiologic turnover of human gastrointestinal epithelial cells is 3 - 5 days (Darwich, 2014); therefore, the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption is expected to be minimal 30 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.afterText: However, the physiologic turnover of human gastrointestinal epithelial cells is 3 - 5 days (Darwich, 2014); therefore, the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption is expected to be minimal 21 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.summary: Changed zinc discontinuation period from 30 days to 21 days to align with other protocol references
